Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can accurately draw a fish and label its parts, such as fins, tail, and gills.
The student can correctly illustrate and label the specific location where the fish lives, such as a pond, river, lake, or ocean.
The student can effectively illustrate and label the water in the habitat as an essential resource needed by the fish to swim and survive.
The student can depict and label additional elements of the fish's habitat, such as plants, rocks, and sand, to represent the environment.
The student can clearly illustrate and explain through labels how the fish interacts with its surroundings, such as swimming in water or hiding among plants.
The student can label and describe through their drawing how all parts of the fish's environment work together to meet its needs, including interactions with other organisms, if relevant.
CANNOT: The student may occasionally omit a label or detail, such as forgetting to label one type of plant in the environment (minor omissions).
The student might not include details unrelated to the fish's survival needs, such as atmospheric conditions or detailed texture of water, given the focus is on the fish's immediate habitat.
